unnormalised: **Manufacturing & Supply Chain: Enhanced Quality Control Measures Implemented at Tata Steel Jamshedpur**
normalised: manufacturing and supply chain enhanced quality control measures implemented at T A T A steel jamshedpur

unnormalised: Jamshedpur, Jharkhand – Tata Steel has announced a significant upgrade to its quality control processes at its flagship manufacturing plant. The initiative, spearheaded by Dr. Sharma and his team, includes advanced sensor technology and AI-driven analysis across various production lines, aiming to reduce defects by 15% in the next quarter.
normalised: jamshedpur, jharkhand – T A T A steel has announced a significant upgrade to its quality control processes at its flagship manufacturing plant. the initiative, spearheaded by doctor sharma and his team, includes advanced sensor technology and A I driven analysis across various production lines, aiming to reduce defects by fifteen percent in the next quarter.

unnormalised: This move follows recent concerns raised by suppliers regarding inconsistencies in raw material quality affecting final product standards. The new system incorporates real-time monitoring of steel composition and structural integrity, ensuring compliance with stringent BIS standards.
normalised: this move follows recent concerns raised by suppliers regarding inconsistencies in raw material quality affecting final product standards. the new system incorporates real time monitoring of steel composition and structural integrity, ensuring compliance with stringent B I S standards.

unnormalised: "Our commitment to delivering top-quality steel is unwavering," stated a company spokesperson. "This investment of Rs. 50 Crores in enhanced quality control will benefit both our downstream customers and contribute to the 'Make in India' initiative."
normalised: "our commitment to delivering top quality steel is unwavering," stated a company spokesperson. "this investment of rupee fifty crores in enhanced quality control will benefit both our downstream customers and contribute to the 'make in india' initiative."

unnormalised: The upgraded facility includes a dedicated quality control lab spanning 2,000 sq ft, equipped with state-of-the-art testing equipment. The initiative also provides comprehensive training to over 200 employees, ensuring they are proficient in utilizing the new technologies. The expected ROI is projected to be achieved within 2 years.
normalised: the upgraded facility includes a dedicated quality control lab spanning two thousand square feet, equipped with state of the art testing equipment. the initiative also provides comprehensive training to over two hundred employees, ensuring they are proficient in utilizing the new technologies. the expected R O I is projected to be achieved within two years.
